entry.value:
Depending on the hobby selected from the dropdown on the previous page there will be different panel controls shown. The panel
control is a handy control that helps set other controls apart, without the need of extensive CSS knowledge. For those in the know,
the panel control places a blank <div> on the page! The panel control is capable of holding any Rapid control, including other panels.
As with other controls in Rapid, the panel can be fully customised using CSS, allowing you to have a multitude of different styles
of panels. If you have selected to use a theme when making your Rapid app then we have already provided you with a few panel style
classes to get you started.

Moving back to the hobbies, the selected hobby is stored in the hidden value control when the page loads. Then there are multiple
logic actions that use this hidden value to determine what panel gets shown. Going into more detail on the hidden value control it is
best used for complex form applications that need to have information stored and used from one page to another. Values
can be used throughout different pages and, as shown on this page, can be used to alter what appears. By using the form action it
is possible to copy details into the hidden value to be used and referenced with logic on this page, and can even be used to alter the
flow of your forms. This makes it quite a powerful control to utilise.

According to our records you are fond of videogames! In the input box below, tell us what types of games you enjoy and
what you are currently most interested in!

validation.message: Please let us know what you think

According to our records you are fond of animals! In the input box below, tell us your favourite animals and what kind of
animal you'd love to have as a pet!

validation.message: Please let us know what you think

According to our records you are fond of politics! In the input box below, tell us what you think of the recent politics
in the UK, and in America if you have been keeping up!

validation.message: Please let us know what you think

According to our records you are fond of writing! In the input box below, tell us what kind of things you have
written about and what you enjoy writing!

validation.message: Please let us know what you think

entry.value:
If it went unmentioned, it is likely that you would only assume this page had only one panel control in it,
asking you an additional question about your interests. As we are making use of what is held in the hidden
value we can define different logic statements using the contents of the hidden value control!

All of the input boxes on this page have a form summary label, along with controls on the previous page. These will each appear on our
summary page, along with any details entered. As mentioned on the previous page, there is the option to go back and alter what has been
previously entered.
// Enter JQuery command here. The event object is passed in as "ev"

page.htmlBody:
Rapid sample form

Depending on the hobby selected from the dropdown on the previous page there will be different panel controls shown. The panel control is a handy control that helps set other controls apart, without the need of extensive CSS knowledge. For those in the know, the panel control places a blank
on the page! The panel control is capable of holding any Rapid control, including other panels. As with other controls in Rapid, the panel can be fully customised using CSS, allowing you to have a multitude of different styles of panels. If you have selected to use a theme when making your Rapid app then we have already provided you with a few panel style classes to get you started.
Moving back to the hobbies, the selected hobby is stored in the hidden value control when the page loads. Then there are multiple logic actions that use this hidden value to determine what panel gets shown. Going into more detail on the hidden value control it is best used for complex form applications that need to have information stored and used from one page to another. Values can be used throughout different pages and, as shown on this page, can be used to alter what appears. By using the form action it is possible to copy details into the hidden value to be used and referenced with logic on this page, and can even be used to alter the flow of your forms. This makes it quite a powerful control to utilise.
According to our records you are fond of videogames! In the input box below, tell us what types of games you enjoy and what you are currently most interested in!
According to our records you are fond of sports! In the input box below, tell us what types of sport you enjoy and which sport most resonates with you!
According to our records you are fond of technology! In the input box below, tell us what what it is about technology the most, and what kind of things you think technology will do in the future!
According to our records you are fond of animals! In the input box below, tell us your favourite animals and what kind of animal you'd love to have as a pet!
According to our records you are fond of politics! In the input box below, tell us what you think of the recent politics in the UK, and in America if you have been keeping up!
According to our records you are fond of writing! In the input box below, tell us what kind of things you have written about and what you enjoy writing!
If it went unmentioned, it is likely that you would only assume this page had only one panel control in it, asking you an additional question about your interests. As we are making use of what is held in the hidden value we can define different logic statements using the contents of the hidden value control!All of the input boxes on this page have a form summary label, along with controls on the previous page. These will each appear on our summary page, along with any details entered. As mentioned on the previous page, there is the option to go back and alter what has been previously entered.
page.name: 03_interests

rolesHtml.html:
Rapid sample form

Depending on the hobby selected from the dropdown on the previous page there will be different panel controls shown. The panel control is a handy control that helps set other controls apart, without the need of extensive CSS knowledge. For those in the know, the panel control places a blank
on the page! The panel control is capable of holding any Rapid control, including other panels. As with other controls in Rapid, the panel can be fully customised using CSS, allowing you to have a multitude of different styles of panels. If you have selected to use a theme when making your Rapid app then we have already provided you with a few panel style classes to get you started.
Moving back to the hobbies, the selected hobby is stored in the hidden value control when the page loads. Then there are multiple logic actions that use this hidden value to determine what panel gets shown. Going into more detail on the hidden value control it is best used for complex form applications that need to have information stored and used from one page to another. Values can be used throughout different pages and, as shown on this page, can be used to alter what appears. By using the form action it is possible to copy details into the hidden value to be used and referenced with logic on this page, and can even be used to alter the flow of your forms. This makes it quite a powerful control to utilise.
According to our records you are fond of videogames! In the input box below, tell us what types of games you enjoy and what you are currently most interested in!
According to our records you are fond of sports! In the input box below, tell us what types of sport you enjoy and which sport most resonates with you!
According to our records you are fond of technology! In the input box below, tell us what what it is about technology the most, and what kind of things you think technology will do in the future!
According to our records you are fond of animals! In the input box below, tell us your favourite animals and what kind of animal you'd love to have as a pet!
According to our records you are fond of politics! In the input box below, tell us what you think of the recent politics in the UK, and in America if you have been keeping up!
According to our records you are fond of writing! In the input box below, tell us what kind of things you have written about and what you enjoy writing!
If it went unmentioned, it is likely that you would only assume this page had only one panel control in it, asking you an additional question about your interests. As we are making use of what is held in the hidden value we can define different logic statements using the contents of the hidden value control!All of the input boxes on this page have a form summary label, along with controls on the previous page. These will each appear on our summary page, along with any details entered. As mentioned on the previous page, there is the option to go back and alter what has been previously entered.

page.title: Main form
